Uses of Interface
org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface

  • Uses of PlaintextContainerInterface in org.securecryptoconfig

    Classes in org.securecryptoconfig that implement PlaintextContainerInterface 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  PlaintextContainer
    Class representing the plaintext processed in cryptographic use cases.
    Methods in org.securecryptoconfig that return PlaintextContainerInterface 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) abstract PlaintextContainerInterface AbstractSCCCiphertext.decryptAsymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey keyPair)
    Asymmetric decryption with a certain SCCKey of SCCCiphertext.
    PlaintextContainerInterface SecureCryptoConfigInterface.decryptAsymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey keyPair, AbstractSCCCiphertext ciphertext)
    Asymmetric decryption with a certain SCCKey for a given SCCCiphertext.
    (package private) abstract PlaintextContainerInterface AbstractSCCCiphertext.decryptSymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey key)
    Symmetric decryption with a certain SCCKey of SCCCiphertext.
    PlaintextContainerInterface SecureCryptoConfigInterface.decryptSymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey key, AbstractSCCCiphertext sccciphertext)
    Decryption of a given SCCCiphertext.

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    protected static SCCCiphertext SecureCryptoConfig.createMessage​(PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext, AbstractSCCKey key, COSE.AlgorithmID id)
    Creation of COSE Encrypt0Message for symmetric Encryption.

    Creation of COSE PasswordHashMessage for password Hashing.
    protected static SCCPasswordHash SecureCryptoConfig.createPasswordHashMessageSalt​(PlaintextContainerInterface password, COSE.AlgorithmID id, byte[] salt)
    Creation of COSE PasswordHashMessage for password hashing with existing salt value.
    protected static SCCSignature SecureCryptoConfig.createSignMessage​(PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext, AbstractSCCKey key, COSE.AlgorithmID id)
    Creation of COSE Sign1Message for signing.

    Asymmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
